question: Who among the following is a Benamidar of a property as per the Prohibition of Benami Property Transactions Act, 2016?
option1: The person who has property title registered in his name but is not its actual owner
option2: The person who is actual owner of the property but does not have its title in his name
option3: Any of the above is a benamidar
option4: None of the above is a benamidar
answer: The person who has property title registered in his name but is not its actual owner
explanation: A Benami transaction is an arrangement in which a property (movable or immovable) is transferred to or held in the name of one person (benamidar) but is actually owned and enjoyed by another person (beneficial owner). This is illegal in India.
